p: There are abundant lysigenous and schizogenous ducts spread within the spongy tissue in the leaves and cortex of the stem in the studied plants. Also, idioblasts containing calcium oxalate crystals are found in the spongy leaf tissue of L. crithmoides. In this context, the presence of secretory structures in certain families, such as Asteraceae and Fabaceae, gave more adaptive prosperity in multiple environments [ 36]. Moreover, the appearance of secretory organs in the same family was reported for Asteraceae, Fabaceae, Salicaceae, Moraceae, Araceae and Cornaceae that are widely distributed in tropical areas [ 36]. Secreted compounds may be greatly affected (increased or decreased) when the plant is exposed to various environmental stresses, like infections, wounds or edaphic or climatic factors [ 37].
